channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Best Programming Language for the End of the World
item.description: Once the grid goes down, an old programming language called Forth—and a new operating system called Collapse OS—may be our only salvation.

item.title: I Went Undercover in Crypto’s Answer to ‘Squid Game.’ It Nearly Broke Me
item.description: I spent 10 days competing in Crypto: The Game, a winner-takes-all contest where hundreds of players try to finesse and backstab their way to claiming ...

item.title: Beneath Greenland’s Ice Lies a Climate Solution—and a New Geopolitical Battleground
item.description: Modern society, and the clean energy revolution, depend on rare earth elements. Can Greenland help break China’s stranglehold on the market?

item.title: The Worm That No Computer Scientist Can Crack
item.description: One of the simplest, most over-studied organisms in the world is the C. elegans nematode. For 13 years, a project called OpenWorm has tried—and utterl...

item.title: Microsoft adds AI-powered deep research tools to Copilot
item.description: Microsoft is introducing a “deep research” AI-powered tool in Microsoft 365 Copilot, its AI chatbot app. There’s been a raft of deep research agents l...

item.title: 101 Best Amazon Spring Sale Deals (2025)
item.description: Now’s your chance to save on our favorite WIRED-tested home and tech gadgets.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: Emergence Capital closes on $1B fund to back B2B companies
item.description: Emergence Capital has closed its $1 billion seventh fund, it reported on Tuesday It’s the firm’s first raise in nearly four years. In May 2021, the Sa...

item.title: How to tell if your online accounts have been hacked
item.description: This is a guide on how to check whether someone compromised your online accounts.

item.title: Read the email Jack Dorsey sent when he cut 931 of Block’s staff
item.description: Block just laid off 931 employees. Read the email from its co-founder Jack Dorsey for more details on why.
